summary: This is a U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) TECS Person Encounter List detailing Jeffrey Epstein's private flight travel in June 2019, shortly before his arrest. It shows three flights between New Jersey (Teterboro) and international destinations (Paris and the Caribbean) on his private jet (N212JE).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is listed as the passenger on three private flights in June 2019, as recorded by U.S. Customs and Border Protection.

events.title: Epstein flight from Teterboro to TIST
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled on his private jet (N212JE) from Teterboro, NJ (KTEB) to TIST (likely an airport code, possibly in the Caribbean).

events.title: Epstein flight from TIST to Teterboro
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein returned on his private jet (N212JE) from TIST to Teterboro, NJ (KTEB).

events.title: Epstein flight from Teterboro to Paris
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled on his private jet (N212JE) from Teterboro, NJ (KTEB) to Paris Le Bourget Airport (LFPB).

locations: Paris, France (LFPB) - Paris Le Bourget Airport
TIST - Likely an airport code, possibly for a Caribbean location (e.g., Cyril E. King Airport in St. Thomas, USVI)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was actively traveling internationally on his private jet (N212JE) in June 2019, just weeks before his arrest on July 6, 2019.
The document records a flight from New Jersey to Paris on June 14, 2019, indicating international movement shortly before legal proceedings intensified.
The travel was monitored and recorded by U.S. Customs and Border Protection via the TECS system, showing official tracking of his movements.
The document is dated June 27, 2019, and was generated by CBP, indicating it was part of law enforcement records prior to his arrest.
